answers.author: Roderick Wood
answers.text:
If your goal is CM, I would advise retaining the ACM position.  City Clerk is a very defined role that does not give you the broader background in local government or management issues.  A career challenge is always making decisions that work toward your ultimate goal and not take side steps for just money or title.  The ACM role and title will serve you much better on your career path..

answers.author: Mark Levin
answers.text:
While I generally agree with the comments made, there may be some reasons to consider the new position. Is there a City Manager in the city recruiting you as clerk? If so, would the manager consider giving you the title of Assistant as well as Clerk? If not, would the Council consider giving you the tile of Director of Administration as well as Clerk? What is the size of the new community and your current community?

author: [Anonymous]
text: I am a recent 2011 MPA Graduate and spent my first two years in local government as a Deputy City Clerk.  My career goal is to become a CM and have recently taken an ACM position.  I am currently being recruited to take on a City Clerk position.  Does any one have any experience in transitioning from a City Clerk to a CM?  I am concerned if a take the City Clerk position, it might set my career path back of becoming a CM.  Any input is much appreciated.
title: City Clerk Position or Assistant City Manager
